channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: For the first time in 35 years, NPR's Hanukkah Lights will be without Susan Stamberg
item.description: This is the first Hanukkah that Murray Horwitz will not be joined by the late Susan Stamberg on NPR's holiday special Hanukkah Lights. We talk with him about their 35 years of making the show.
item.content:encoded: This is the first Hanukkah that Murray Horwitz will not be joined by the late Susan Stamberg on NPR's holiday special Hanukkah Lights. We talk with him about their 35 years of making the show.
item.dc:creator: Murray Horwitz

item.title: One U.S. diplomat describes being laid off amid sweeping cuts
item.description: After 14 years as a U.S. diplomat, one officer talks about being laid off in the State Department's sweeping cuts, losing both career and professional identity.
item.content:encoded: After 14 years as a U.S. diplomat, one officer talks about being laid off in the State Department's sweeping cuts, losing both career and professional identity.
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: The latest in Ukraine peace talks and war-time elections
item.description: As Europe and Ukraine offer counterproposals to the White House's Kremlin-friendly plan to end Russia's war on Ukraine, Ukraine's president explores holding wartime elections on ceding territory.
item.content:encoded: As Europe and Ukraine offer counterproposals to the White House's Kremlin-friendly plan to end Russia's war on Ukraine, Ukraine's president explores holding wartime elections on ceding territory.
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: 19 photos were released from the Epstein files. We unpack their significance
item.description: Nineteen of 95,000 photos for the Jeffrey Epstein files were released by a House committee Friday. What do they tell us and when will more information be available?
item.content:encoded: Nineteen of 95,000 photos for the Jeffrey Epstein files were released by a House committee Friday. What do they tell us and when will more information be available?
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Marquez Janse

item.title: About 100,000 remain under evacuation notice as rivers swell in western Washington
item.description: Tens of thousands of Washingtonians remain under evacuation advisories after successive storms swelled rivers in the Western part of the state. It's not clear yet what damage the region sustained.
item.content:encoded: Tens of thousands of Washingtonians remain under evacuation advisories after successive storms swelled rivers in the Western part of the state. It's not clear yet what damage the region sustained.
item.dc:creator: Casey Martin

item.title: The best albums of 2025
item.description: Pop critic Ann Powers shares a handful the albums on NPR Music's list of the best of the year, including the one album that nearly the entire team agreed on.
item.content:encoded: Pop critic Ann Powers shares a handful the albums on NPR Music's list of the best of the year, including the one album that nearly the entire team agreed on.
item.dc:creator: Ann Powers

item.title: Honey flavor reaches new depths with... spotted lanternfly droppings
item.description: Savory, sour and earthy tasting honey could be the new normal thanks to a new ingredient. Spotted lanternfly poop. The insects spread along the east coast across could usher in new ways to use honey.
item.content:encoded: Savory, sour and earthy tasting honey could be the new normal thanks to a new ingredient. Spotted lanternfly poop. The insects spread along the east coast across could usher in new ways to use honey.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: 'She's awesome': How U.S. veterans helped Venezuela's Machado escape
item.description: In a daring nighttime martime operation, U.S. veterans whisked Venezuela's María Corina Machado out of the country to claim her Nobel Peace Prize in Oslo
item.content:encoded:
In a daring nighttime martime operation, U.S. veterans whisked Venezuela's María Corina Machado out of the country to claim her Nobel Peace Prize in Oslo

(Image credit: ODD ANDERSEN)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: Old divides in a new Syria
item.description: One year after the ousting of the Assad regime, some of the first Syrian revolutionaries return to their homes and try to start their lives again. But new divisions and old animosities still fester.
item.content:encoded: One year after the ousting of the Assad regime, some of the first Syrian revolutionaries return to their homes and try to start their lives again. But new divisions and old animosities still fester.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: Why one trauma doctor sees self-driving cars as a 'public health breakthrough'
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks to Dr. Jonathan Slotkin about the new data released by Waymo about accidents and their self-driving cars.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks to Dr. Jonathan Slotkin about the new data released by Waymo about accidents and their self-driving cars.
item.dc:creator: Matt Ozug
